private_information: I am manipulator1 and I executed the first half of the scheduled actions (actions 1 to 24).

Assigned actions executed by me in order: unstack(A,B), putdown(A), unstack(K,H), putdown(K), unstack(C,I), stack(C,M), pickup(A), stack(A,I), unstack(A,I), stack(A,H), unstack(B,J), stack(B,I), unstack(C,M), stack(C,M), unstack(C,M), stack(C,A), pickup(K), stack(K,J), unstack(M,F), putdown(M), pickup(M), stack(M,F), unstack(B,I), stack(B,C).
I observed the local effects of those actions and can report the blocks I moved and the local stack changes I observed.
manipulator1.goal: Execute the assigned sequence of block-manipulation actions, observe and report the effects accurately.

private_information: I am manipulator2 and I executed the second half of the scheduled actions (actions 25 to 50).

Assigned actions executed by me in order: unstack(K,J), putdown(K), unstack(I,N), stack(I,B), unstack(I,B), putdown(I), unstack(J,D), putdown(J), pickup(J), stack(J,K), unstack(M,F), stack(M,B), pickup(F), stack(F,D), unstack(M,B), stack(M,N), unstack(M,N), stack(M,J), pickup(N), stack(N,F), pickup(I), stack(I,N), unstack(I,N), stack(I,M), unstack(B,C), stack(B,I).
I observed the local effects of those actions and can report the blocks I moved and the local stack changes I observed.
manipulator2.goal: Execute the assigned sequence of block-manipulation actions, observe and report the effects accurately.

private_information: I coordinate the information coming from manipulator1 and manipulator2 and must produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that represents the Blocks World with the final state implied by the combined action trace.
I must keep agent actions distinct when integrating observations and must produce a combined model that is solvable by FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the manipulators' execution reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem (targeting FastDownwards) that models the Blocks World and the final arrangement after the provided action sequence.

public_information: Domain: Standard Blocks World where only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks involved: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N.
Initial arrangement (bottom->top per column): Column1: E, G, D, J, B, A. Column2: F, M. Column3: L, H, K. Column4: N, I, C. Table supports multiple stacks.
Explicit initial relationships: A on B, B on J, J on D, D on G, G on E, E on table; C on I, I on N, N on table; K on H, H on L, L on table; M on F, F on table.

Action sequence executed (in order): 1 unstack(A,B), 2 putdown(A), 3 unstack(K,H), 4 putdown(K), 5 unstack(C,I), 6 stack(C,M), 7 pickup(A), 8 stack(A,I), 9 unstack(A,I), 10 stack(A,H), 11 unstack(B,J), 12 stack(B,I), 13 unstack(C,M), 14 stack(C,M), 15 unstack(C,M), 16 stack(C,A), 17 pickup(K), 18 stack(K,J), 19 unstack(M,F), 20 putdown(M), 21 pickup(M), 22 stack(M,F), 23 unstack(B,I), 24 stack(B,C), 25 unstack(K,J), 26 putdown(K), 27 unstack(I,N), 28 stack(I,B), 29 unstack(I,B), 30 putdown(I), 31 unstack(J,D), 32 putdown(J), 33 pickup(J), 34 stack(J,K), 35 unstack(M,F), 36 stack(M,B), 37 pickup(F), 38 stack(F,D), 39 unstack(M,B), 40 stack(M,N), 41 unstack(M,N), 42 stack(M,J), 43 pickup(N), 44 stack(N,F), 45 pickup(I), 46 stack(I,N), 47 unstack(I,N), 48 stack(I,M), 49 unstack(B,C), 50 stack(B,I).

Final arrangement derived from the initial arrangement after applying the full action sequence: K is on the table; J is on K; M is on J; I is on M; B is on I (stack K->J->M->I->B). L is on the table; H is on L; A is on H; C is on A (stack L->H->A->C). E is on the table; G is on E; D is on G; F is on D; N is on F (stack E->G->D->F->N).

report.system_prompt: You are manipulator1. Provide an accurate, itemized report of the actions you executed (the subset assigned to you), the local preconditions you observed, and the local effects on stacks. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the report as plain text describing the observed stack changes and moved blocks.
report.prompt: You are manipulator1. Based on your private information list the actions you executed, describe for each action the immediate effect on the stack where it was applied, and list the final local stacks you observed after action 24. Keep the description factual and do not produce PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You are manipulator2. Provide an accurate, itemized report of the actions you executed (the subset assigned to you), the local preconditions you observed, and the local effects on stacks. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the report as plain text describing the observed stack changes and moved blocks.
report.prompt: You are manipulator2. Based on your private information list the actions you executed, describe for each action the immediate effect on the stack where it was applied, and list the final local stacks you observed after action 50. Keep the description factual and do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the two manipulators' reports, resolve any naming inconsistencies, and produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that capture the Blocks World instance and the final arrangement resulting from the full action trace. The PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if modeling multi-agent actions, but the produced PDDL should be a single-agent planning encoding appropriate for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive two textual reports from manipulator1 and manipulator2 describing their executed actions and local observations. Integrate these reports into a single consistent Blocks World model and produce: 1) a PDDL domain modeling standard Blocks World predicates and actions compatible with FastDownwards, and 2) a PDDL problem file whose initial state matches the initial configuration and whose goal state corresponds to the final arrangement produced by the combined action trace. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not assume any actions beyond those reported. Ensure objects, predicates, and action definitions follow FastDownwards conventions.
